scalar:array.comment: /** * Smarty plugin * * @package Smarty * @subpackage Security * @author Uwe Tews */

/* * FIXME: Smarty_Security API * - getter and setter instead of public properties would allow cultivating an internal cache properly * - current implementation of isTrustedResourceDir() assumes that Smarty::$template_dir and Smarty::$config_dir are immutable * the cache is killed every time either of the variables change. That means that two distinct Smarty objects with differing * $template_dir or $config_dir should NOT share the same Smarty_Security instance, * as this would lead to (severe) performance penalty! how should this be handled? */

/** * This determines how Smarty handles "" tags in templates. * possible values: *
    *
  • Smarty::PHP_PASSTHRU -> echo PHP tags as they are
    • *
  • Smarty::PHP_QUOTE -> escape tags as entities
    • *
  • Smarty::PHP_REMOVE -> remove php tags
    • *
  • Smarty::PHP_ALLOW -> execute php tags
    • *
* * @var integer */
/** * This is the list of template directories that are considered secure. * $template_dir is in this list implicitly. * * @var array */
/** * This is an array of directories where trusted php scripts reside. * {@link $security} is disabled during their inclusion/execution. * * @var array */
/** * List of regular expressions (PCRE) that include trusted URIs * * @var array */
/** * This is an array of trusted static classes. * * If empty access to all static classes is allowed. * If set to 'none' none is allowed. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of trusted PHP functions. * * If empty all functions are allowed. * To disable all PHP functions set $php_functions = null. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of trusted PHP modifiers. * * If empty all modifiers are allowed. * To disable all modifier set $modifiers = null. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of allowed tags. * * If empty no restriction by allowed_tags. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of disabled tags. * * If empty no restriction by disabled_tags. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of allowed modifier plugins. * * If empty no restriction by allowed_modifiers. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of disabled modifier plugins. * * If empty no restriction by disabled_modifiers. * @var array */
/** * This is an array of trusted streams. * * If empty all streams are allowed. * To disable all streams set $streams = null. * @var array */
/** * + flag if constants can be accessed from template * @var boolean */
/** * + flag if super globals can be accessed from template * @var boolean */
/** * Cache for $resource_dir lookups * @var array */
/** * Cache for $template_dir lookups * @var array */
/** * Cache for $config_dir lookups * @var array */
/** * Cache for $secure_dir lookups * @var array */
/** * Cache for $php_resource_dir lookups * @var array */
/** * Cache for $trusted_dir lookups * @var array */

/** * Check if PHP function is trusted. * * @param string $function_name * @param object $compiler compiler object * @return boolean true if function is trusted * @throws SmartyCompilerException if php function is not trusted */

/** * Check if static class is trusted. * * @param string $class_name * @param object $compiler compiler object * @return boolean true if class is trusted * @throws SmartyCompilerException if static class is not trusted */

/** * Check if PHP modifier is trusted. * * @param string $modifier_name * @param object $compiler compiler object * @return boolean true if modifier is trusted * @throws SmartyCompilerException if modifier is not trusted */

/** * Check if tag is trusted. * * @param string $tag_name * @param object $compiler compiler object * @return boolean true if tag is trusted * @throws SmartyCompilerException if modifier is not trusted */
// check for internal always required tags
// check security settings

/** * Check if modifier plugin is trusted. * * @param string $modifier_name * @param object $compiler compiler object * @return boolean true if tag is trusted * @throws SmartyCompilerException if modifier is not trusted */
// check for internal always allowed modifier
// check security settings
/** * Check if stream is trusted. * * @param string $stream_name * @return boolean true if stream is trusted * @throws SmartyException if stream is not trusted */
/** * Check if directory of file resource is trusted. * * @param string $filepath * @return boolean true if directory is trusted * @throws SmartyException if directory is not trusted */
// check if index is outdated
// rebuild template dir index
// rebuild config dir index
// rebuild secure dir index
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// test if the directory is trusted
// merge sub directories of current $directory into _resource_dir to speed up subsequent lookups
// merge sub directories of current $directory into _resource_dir to speed up subsequent lookups
// merge sub directories of current $directory into _resource_dir to speed up subsequent lookups
// abort if we've reached root
// bubble up one level
// bubble up one level
// give up

/** * Check if URI (e.g. {fetch} or {html_image}) is trusted * * To simplify things, isTrustedUri() resolves all input to "{$PROTOCOL}://{$HOSTNAME}". * So "http://username:password@hello.world.example.org:8080/some-path?some=query-string" * is reduced to "http://hello.world.example.org" prior to applying the patters from {@link $trusted_uri}. * @param string $uri * @return boolean true if URI is trusted * @throws SmartyException if URI is not trusted * @uses $trusted_uri for list of patterns to match against $uri */
/** * Check if directory of file resource is trusted. * * @param string $filepath * @return boolean true if directory is trusted * @throws SmartyException if PHP directory is not trusted */

scalar:array.scalar:string: ' not allowed by security setting (no trusted_dir specified)

scalar:array.comment: // check if index is outdated
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// remember the directory to add it to _resource_dir in case we're successful
// test if the directory is trusted
// merge sub directories of current $directory into _resource_dir to speed up subsequent lookups

// abort if we've reached root

/** * Smarty plugin * * @package Smarty * @subpackage Security * @author Uwe Tews */

/* * FIXME: Smarty_Security API * - getter and setter instead of public properties would allow cultivating an internal cache properly * - current implementation of isTrustedResourceDir() assumes that Smarty::$template_dir and Smarty::$config_dir are immutable * the cache is killed every time either of the variables change. That means that two distinct Smarty objects with differing * $template_dir or $config_dir should NOT share the same Smarty_Security instance, * as this would lead to (severe) performance penalty! how should this be handled? */
